Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe
= state in which humans are trembling with fear

Node.gloss: to respect|to look upon or treat with favor|to honor
Node.definition: literally: to lift up (someone's) face; hence: = action by which humans or deities show favor or respect to someone, ◄ as if by allowing someone who is looking down out of shame or humility to look up directly into one's face
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to be guilty|to be in the wrong|to have wronged
Node.definition: = to bear the responsiblity for an unlawful deed, that was committed either knowingly or unknowingly
= male deity; ► worshiped by Canaanites (כְּנַעֲנִי) ≈ regarded as the possessor of a certain location
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
= process by which an action is repeated or continued
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= person with the skill to produce an artifact out of rough materials, such as stone, wood, metal

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= male young of a cow (פָּרָה) ► used as a symbol for a deity; also used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with being willful and untrained

= action with which a person touches her or his lips to another person (usually on the lips or cheek or hand) or to an object ► to show love or respect or devotion; also used when greeting and saying goodbye
= a visible collection of condensed water vapor hanging in the atmosphere, often high above the ground ≈ also used to represent God's presence and activity
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= condensed moisture resulting from contact of air and cooler land surfaces; ►an important source of water for vegetation; ≈ regarded as refreshing, life enhancing; associated with fertility
= process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

= level, circular area about 7.5 to 12 meters in diameter, where people threshed their grain; usually located near the fields where the grain was grown, and if possible, in an elevated area that was exposed to the breeze
= opening in a wall
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= marker indicating that an object or event is not included in a range of objects or events
literally: to know (God); hence: = action by which humans, either as individuals or as groups, assume a position of subservience towards a deity
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= particle marking a constituent or part of a constituent as the only condition for the entire proposition to be true
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
literally: to know; hence: = state in which humans or deities are actively involved in circumstances relating to the life of humans and animals and care for their well being
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

see רעה (רעה)|= action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled
literally: (one's) heart becomes high; hence: = process by which humans start to consider themselves greater than justified
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = male lion (אֲרִי) that is no longer living with its pride and wanders around alone

= one of the great cat family of about 2 m in length and of a yellowish brown color with black spots arranged in rosettes all over the body and the tail; ◄ Panthera pardus; ► hunts by stalking prey; ≈ symbol of violent danger

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= action by which humans or animals fix their eyes on a particular goal and observe it

= large mammal with thick fur and a rather doglike face; walks on all fours but may stand up on its back legs to get a better view; maybe 2 meters tall when standing up and weigh over 200 kilos; feeds on roots, berries, wild fruit, mice, and lizards, and, occasionally, small livestock; ◄ |iUrsus arctos syriacus|i*; ► dangerous when provoked or robbed of cubs; ≈ associated with violence and danger
= state in which humans or animals have lost one or more of their offspring

Node.gloss: to tear|to rend|to cut|to rip|to split
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or animals rip apart the human body or an inanimate object, either in part of entirely; usually with their hands
literally: the covering of the heart; hence, probably: = the bony frame formed by the ribs, which covers the heart

= the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression, fearlessness, and respect
possibly shortened form of נֶפֶשׁ חַיָּה living creature: = animal; ◄ generic, sometimes referring to all animals, sometimes limited to wild land animals only

= a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

Node.gloss: to split|to cleave|to rip open|to cut|to rend|to maul|to divide|to break through
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities or human cause an object to split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier
read as variant of אַיֵּה (אַיֵּה)|= a reference to an unknown location, but focused on the question whether an object actually exists at all, rather than with a specific location in mind
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= particle linking two propositions, by which Y represents the purpose or result of X
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= state in which conditions are confined to one single place as a result of being completely surrounded by some kind of force, ≈ as if they were physically bound or wrapped up
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe
literally: to store up events in one's mind; hence: = action by which deities keep a record of events ► in order to act upon them at a later date
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= experience of having painful contractions of the womb; ◄ caused by advanced state of pregnancy; ► and resulting in the birth of new offspring; ≈ associated with fear and agony
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment
= abode of the dead; ≈ considered to be a remote place, deep in the earth, with power over humankind, without remembrance, without praising God

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself

read as conjugated form of היה (היה)|read as variant of אַיֵּה (אַיֵּה)|= a reference to an unknown location, but focused on the (often rhetorical) question whether an event may ever take place at all, rather than with a specific location in mind
in a strict sense: = an epidemic disease ► that causes high mortality; in a wider sense: = any widespread affliction, calamity, or evil, ≈ especially one regarded as a direct punishment by God
= abode of the dead; ≈ considered to be a remote place, deep in the earth, with power over humankind, without remembrance, without praising God

read as conjugated form of היה (היה)|read as variant of אַיֵּה (אַיֵּה)|= a reference to an unknown location, but focused on the (often rhetorical) question whether an event may ever take place at all, rather than with a specific location in mind
= event that causes the end of a large number of people

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment
= state in which deities experience a desire to make other humans feel relief after a time of grief
= state in which certain information is not generally known, ◄ as if it were physically hidden

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not|= type of grass; ◄ found on the borders of the Nile (יְאֹר) ► eaten by cattle
= process by which humans, animals, or plants produce much offspring, ► and so grow in number and strength

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself
= state of being without water or moisture; ≈ possibly with an implicit connotation of shame

= process by which a body of water or place that was formerly covered with moisture dries up, ◄ as a result of evaporation or draining; ► in the case of land, if this condition persists, sedentary life will become impossible
= an opening in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it; ≈ its water is regarded as a source of blessing
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= place(s) where one's valuable goods are store
= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes
= state in which objects have such a high quality ► that they provoke in others the desire to possess them
